Description: This session will initiate a conversation about molecular tumor profiling for clinical care and discovery in pediatric oncology. Experts in pediatric brain tumors, solid malignancies and leukemia will provide a high-level review of existing evidence addressing the contribution of molecular profiling to clinical care. A selection of ongoing sequencing programs will be presented. International perspectives including a consideration of low resource care settings will be addressed. Presentations will be followed by a discussion allowing initial exploration by attendees and panelists of challenges in integrating tumor molecular profiling into clinical care and priority questions for ongoing research in pediatric precision oncology.
SearchResultBody: DC11. Tumor Molecular Profiling of Cancers in Children: Expanding Research and International Collaboration to Advance Clinical Care
Title: Tumor Molecular Profiling of Cancers in Children: Expanding Research and International Collaboration to Advance Clinical Care
